Package com.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.strategy

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    GraphStrategy
    Defines a collection of functions that plug-in to Gremlin Structure API methods to enhance or alter the functionality of the implementation.
    Strategy
    A traverser of a GraphStrategy object owned by a Graph instance.
    StrategyWrapped
    A marker interface for the graph wrapper classes.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GraphStrategy.DefaultGraphStrategy  
    IdGraphStrategy
    A GraphStrategy implementation which enables custom element IDs even for those graphs which don't otherwise support them.
    IdGraphStrategy.Builder  
    PartitionGraphStrategy
    A GraphStrategy which enables support for logical graph partitioning where the Graph can be blinded to different parts of the total Graph
    ReadOnlyGraphStrategy
    This GraphStrategy prevents the graph from being modified and will throw a UnsupportedOperationException if an attempt is made to do so.
    ReadOnlyGraphStrategy.Exceptions  
    SequenceGraphStrategy  
    Strategy.Context<T extends StrategyWrapped>
    The Strategy.Context object is provided to the methods of GraphStrategy so that the strategy functions it constructs have some knowledge of the environment.
    Strategy.Local
    A Strategy implementation where the GraphStrategy can be get or set as ThreadLocal.
    Strategy.Simple
    Basic Strategy implementation where the GraphStrategy can be get or set.
    StrategyWrappedEdge  
    StrategyWrappedEdge.StrategyWrappedEdgeIterator  
    StrategyWrappedElement  
    StrategyWrappedGraph
    A wrapper class for Graph instances that host and apply a GraphStrategy.
    StrategyWrappedProperty<V>  
    StrategyWrappedVariables  
    StrategyWrappedVertex  
    StrategyWrappedVertex.StrategyWrappedVertexIterator  
    StrategyWrappedVertexProperty<V>  
    SubgraphStrategy
    A GraphStrategy which creates a logical subgraph to selectively include vertices and edges of a Graph according to provided criteria.
